ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
The Joint Air-to-Ground Missile (JAGM) program is an Army-led, Acquisition Category (ACAT) IC Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP) with joint interest with the United States (U.S.) Air Force, U.S. Marine Corps (USMC), and U.S. Navy. The JAGM is the next generation of aviation-launched, fire and forget missiles to replace the HELLFIRE Laser and Longbow radar missiles. JAGM will be used by joint service aircraft for destruction of high value stationary, moving, and relocatable land and maritime targets from standoff range in day, night, adverse weather, and obscured battlefield conditions.

The Fiscal Year (FY) 2021 dollars in the amount of $8.900 million will continue the objective platform review, analysis, and threat management; continue the development of the Captive Air Training Missile (CATM) to address training needs; continue test and evaluation and develop documentation for Air Worthiness Release.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
The Joint Air-to-Ground Missile (JAGM) program is an Army-led, Acquisition Category (ACAT) IC Major Defense Acquisition Program (MDAP) with joint interest with the
United States (U.S.) Air Force, U.S. Marine Corps (USMC), and U.S. Navy. The JAGM is the next generation of aviation-launched, fire and forget missiles to replace the HELLFIRE Laser and Longbow radar missiles. JAGM will be used by joint service aircraft for destruction of high value stationary, moving, and relocatable land and maritime targets from standoff range in day, night, adverse weather, and obscured battlefield conditions.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and Other Government Agencies (OGAs) will confirm that JAGM is producible, as well as operable, safe, and logistically supportable.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office will conduct government testing and Full Materiel Release (FMR) documentation to support a FRP decision.
The JAGM Product Office completed government testing and Full Material Release (FMR) documentation to support a FRP decision.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding decrease from FY 2020 to FY 2021 due to Full Rate Production Decision Review scheduled for May 2020.

Title.val: Post MS C Developmental, Integrated, and Operational Testing

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will demonstrate JAGM Operational Suitability and Effectiveness with AH-64E.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will complete Live Fire T&E, verify AH-64 software integration with JAGM through captive carry and JAGM flight tests, regression flight tests, environmental and ground launch tests for Safety Release and Airworthiness Release, and Apache-launched flight tests in preparation for IOT&E, and support other platform integration. Data will also support FRP decision review and FMR.

Title.val: Apache AH-64E and JAGM Software Integration

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office will continue to work JAGM capability on E-model Apaches.

Text.val: The Apache Project Office, by way of Boeing Company, will complete and provide Pilot-Vehicle interface (PVI) capability that is required for seamless JAGM integration on the Apache platform.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will continue objective platform review, analysis, and threat management.  The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will perform technical assessments, concept studies, prepare documentation, and perform risk reduction efforts.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office will manage and mitigate risk against emerging threats and conduct review and analysis of objective platforms.

The JAGM Product Office and OGAs conducted government software testing as well as review and analysis of objective Army platforms.  Software testing included risk mitigation against emerging threats.  The JAGM Product Office and OGAs performed technical assessments, concept studies, prepared documentation, and performed risk reduction efforts.

The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will continue government software testing as well as review and analysis of objective Army platforms. The JAGM Product Office will address emerging threats via risk mitigation software testing and stand off capability to increase platform and crew survivability.  The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will perform technical assessments, concept studies, prepare documentation, and perform risk reduction efforts.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 due to risk mitigation against counter measure/emerging threats and analysis of objective platforms.

Description.val: The CATM is used for captive flight training and for qualification of aircrews to employ tactical missiles in combat.  The JAGM Product Office will develop an inert missile configuration that will meet training needs.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and prime contractor initiated JAGM CATM development.  The prime contractor developed CATM hardware and software.

The JAGM Product Office and prime contractor will continue JAGM CATM development. The prime contractor will develop CATM
hardware and software.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding increase from FY20 to FY21 due to continued CATM Development.

Description.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will continue development testing and qualification of the JAGM CATM; achieve air worthiness on threshold platforms.

Text.val: The JAGM Product Office and OGAs will continue Test and Evaluation and develop documentation for Air Worthiness Release. Test and Evaluation will verify AH-64E Software Integration through captive carry and environmental testing.

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding increase from FY 2020 to FY 2021 due to the CATM testing.

Description.val: Funding transferred in accordance with Title 15 USC ?638

Text.val: Funding transferred in accordance with Title 15 USC ?638

AppChangeSummary.val: Funding transferred in accordance with Title 15 USC ?638

AcquisitionStrategy.val: The JAGM Production and Deployment (PD) Acquisition Strategy (AS) was approved at Milestone C on 15 June 2018. Three Low-Rate Initial Production (LRIP) contract options were awarded in August, September, and December 2018.  Initial Operational Capability (IOC) of 96 missiles and was achieved in March 2019.  Initial Operational Testing was completed in May 2019.  Full Rate Production Decision Review is scheduled for May 2020.
